00004 /*! \file cvm-pci.h
00005     \brief Core Driver: PCI instruction format and core mem mapping.
00006 */
00007 
00008 
00009 #ifndef __CVM_PCI_H__
00010 #define __CVM_PCI_H__
00011 
00012 #include "cvmx.h"
00013 
00014 
00015 /* The 4 PCI ports are from 32 to 35  */
00016 #define    FIRST_PCI_PORT                   32
00017 #define    LAST_PCI_PORT                    35
00018 
00019 #define    DRV_REQUEST_DONE                 0
00020 
00021 
00022 
00023 
00024 /** Core: The (Packet) Instruction Header appears in the format shown below for 
00025   * Octeon. Refer to the Octeon HW Manual to read more about the 
00026   * conversion from PCI instruction header to Packet Instruction Header.
00027   */
00028 typedef union {
00029     uint64_t   u64;
00030     struct {
00031 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00032        uint64_t   tag:32;        /**< 31-00 Tag for the Packet. */
00033        cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tt:2; /**< 33-32 Tagtype */
00034        uint64_t   rs:1;          /**< 34    Is the PCI packet a RAW-SHORT? */
00035        uint64_t   grp:4;         /**< 38-35 The group that gets this Packet */
00036        uint64_t   qos: 3;        /**< 41-39 The QOS set for this Packet. */
00037        uint64_t   rsvd3:6;       /**< 47-42 Reserved */
00038        uint64_t   sl:7;          /**< 54-48 Skip Length */
00039        uint64_t   rsvd2:1;       /**< 55    Reserved. */
00040        uint64_t   pm:2;          /**< 57-56 The parse mode to use for the packet. */
00041        uint64_t   rsvd1:5;       /**< 62-58 Reserved */
00042        uint64_t   r:1;           /**< 63    Is the PCI packet in RAW-mode? */
00043 #else
00044        uint64_t   r:1;           /**< 63    Is the PCI packet in RAW-mode? */
00045        uint64_t   rsvd1:5;       /**< 62-58 Reserved */
00046        uint64_t   pm:2;          /**< 57-56 The parse mode to use for the packet. */
00047        uint64_t   rsvd2:1;       /**< 55    Reserved. */
00048        uint64_t   sl:7;          /**< 54-48 Skip Length */
00049        uint64_t   rsvd3:6;       /**< 47-42 Reserved */
00050        uint64_t   qos: 3;        /**< 41-39 The QOS set for this Packet. */
00051        uint64_t   grp:4;         /**< 38-35 The group that gets this Packet */
00052        uint64_t   rs:1;          /**< 34    Is the PCI packet a RAW-SHORT? */
00053        cvmx_pow_tag_type_t tt:2; /**< 33-32 Tagtype */
00054        uint64_t   tag:32;        /**< 31-00 Tag for the Packet. */
00055 #endif
00056     } s;
00057 } cvm_pci_inst_hdr2_t;
00058 
00059 
00060 
00061 
00062 /** Core: Format of the input request header in an instruction. */
00063 typedef union  {
00064 
00065     uint64_t  u64;
00066     struct {
00067 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00068         uint64_t    rid:16;     /**< Request ID  */
00069         uint64_t    pcie_port:3;/**< PCIe port to send response. */ 
00070         uint64_t    scatter:1;  /**< Scatter indicator  1=scatter */
00071         uint64_t    rlenssz:14; /**< Size of Expected result OR no. of entries in scatter list */
00072         uint64_t    dport:6;    /**< Desired destination port for result */
00073         uint64_t    param:8;    /**< Opcode Specific parameters */
00074         uint64_t    opcode:16;  /**< Opcode for the return packet  */
00075 #else
00076         uint64_t    opcode:16;  /**< Opcode for the return packet  */
00077         uint64_t    param:8;    /**< Opcode Specific parameters */
00078         uint64_t    dport:6;    /**< Desired destination port for result */
00079         uint64_t    rlenssz:14; /**< Size of Expected result OR no. of entries in scatter list */
00080         uint64_t    scatter:1;  /**< Scatter indicator  1=scatter */
00081         uint64_t    pcie_port:3;/**< PCIe port to send response. */
00082         uint64_t    rid:16;     /**< Request ID  */
00083 #endif
00084     }s;
00085 
00086 } cvmx_pci_inst_irh_t;
00087 
00088 
00089 
00090 
00091 /** Core: Format of the front data for a raw instruction in the first 24 bytes
00092  *  of the wqe->packet_data or packet ptr when a core gets work from a PCI input
00093  *  port.
00094  */
00095 typedef struct  {
00096 
00097   /** The instruction header. */
00098    cvm_pci_inst_hdr2_t   ih;
00099 
00100   /** The host physical address where a response (if any) is expected. */
00101    uint64_t              rptr;
00102 
00103   /** The input request header. */
00104    cvmx_pci_inst_irh_t   irh;
00105 
00106 } cvmx_raw_inst_front_t;
00107 
00108 
00109 #define CVM_RAW_FRONT_SIZE   (sizeof(cvmx_raw_inst_front_t))
00110 
00111 
00112 
00113 
00114 /** Core: Format of the response header in the first 8 bytes of response sent
00115  * to the host. */
00116 typedef union   {
00117 
00118   uint64_t      u64;
00119   struct {
00120 
00121    /** Opcode tells the host the type of response. */
00122    uint64_t      opcode:16;
00123 
00124     /** The response is for a host instruction that arrived at this port. */
00125    uint64_t      sport:6;
00126 
00127     /** The destination port or driver-specific queue number. */
00128    uint64_t      destqport:22;
00129 
00130    uint64_t      reserved:4;
00131 
00132     /** The request id of the host instruction. */
00133    uint64_t      request_id:16;
00134   }s;
00135 
00136 }cvmx_resp_hdr_t;
00137 
00138 
00139 #define  CVMX_RESP_HDR_SIZE   (sizeof(cvmx_resp_hdr_t))
00140 
00141 
00142 
00143 
00144 
00145 /** Core: The core driver routines can handle local pointers of the these
00146   * types. 
00147   */
00148 typedef enum {
00149    CVM_DIRECT_DATA = 0, /**< Local Pointer points directly to data */
00150    CVM_GATHER_DATA = 1, /**< Local Pointer points to a gather list of local pointers */
00151    CVM_LINKED_DATA = 2, /**< Local pointer points to data which has links to more buffers */
00152    CVM_NULL_DATA   = 3  /**< If no data is sent and a flag is required, use this. */
00153 } cvm_ptr_type_t;
00154 
00155 
00156 
00157 
00158 
00159 
00160 /** Get the size of data in the first packet buffer in a WQE from PCI.
00161   * @param bufptr - the packet pointer from wqe (wqe->packet_ptr).
00162   * @param raw    - flag to indicate if the PCI packet is in RAW mode.
00163   * @return Returns the size of data in this packet buffer.
00164   */
00165 static inline int
00166 cvm_get_first_buf_size(cvmx_buf_ptr_t   bufptr, int raw)
00167 {
00168     int  len=0;
00169 
00170     len = ( ( (cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_IPD_PACKET_MBUFF_SIZE) & 0xfff)
00171           - ((cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_IPD_1ST_MBUFF_SKIP) & 0x3f) + 1) ) * 8)
00172           - (bufptr.s.addr & 0x7);
00173     if(raw)
00174         len -= CVM_RAW_FRONT_SIZE;
00175 
00176     return len;
00177 }
00178 
00179 
00180 /** Call this routine to get the size of data for packet buffers following
00181   * the first buffer in a WQE from PCI.
00182   * @return Returns the size of data in this packet buffer.
00183   */
00184 static inline int
00185 cvm_get_next_buf_size(void)
00186 {
00187     return  (((cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_IPD_PACKET_MBUFF_SIZE) & 0xfff)
00188              - ((cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_IPD_NOT_1ST_MBUFF_SKIP) & 0x3f) + 1)) * 8);
00189 }
00190 
00191 
00192 
00193 /** Call this routine with virtual address of packet buffer to get the
00194   * address of the next packet buffer in the WQE chain.
00195   * @param pktptr - virtual address of packet buffer
00196   * @return Returns the virtual address of next packet buffer.
00197   */
00198 static inline void *
00199 cvm_get_next_pkt_ptr(void  *pktptr)
00200 {
00201     cvmx_buf_ptr_t  *ptr = (cvmx_buf_ptr_t *)((uint8_t *)pktptr - 8); 
00202     return (void *)cvmx_phys_to_ptr(ptr->s.addr);
00203 }

00208 #endif  /* __CVM_PCI_H__ */
